metadata.title: CVE-2017-5087 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A use after free in Blink in Google Chrome prior to 59.0.3071.104 for Mac,Windows, and Linux, and 59.0.3071.117 for Android, allowed a remoteattacker to perform an out of bounds memory read via a crafted HTML page,aka an IndexedDB sandbox escape.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5087` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-browser-l10n - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-chromedriver - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360').
